com.github.mikephil.charting.components

Class Legend

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mikephil.charting.components.ComponentBase
      • com.github.mikephil.charting.components.Legend

  • public class Legend
extends ComponentBase
    Class representing the legend of the chart. The legend will contain one entry per color and DataSet. Multiple colors in one DataSet are grouped together. The legend object is NOT available before setting data to the chart.

      • getExtraColors

        public int[] getExtraColors()
        colors that will be appended to the end of the colors array after calculating the legend.

      • getExtraLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getExtraLabels()
        labels that will be appended to the end of the labels array after calculating the legend. a null label will start a group.

      • setExtra

        public void setExtra(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> colors,
            java.util.List<java.lang.String> labels)
        Colors and labels that will be appended to the end of the auto calculated colors and labels arrays after calculating the legend. (if the legend has already been calculated, you will need to call notifyDataSetChanged() to let the changes take effect)

      • setExtra

        public void setExtra(int[] colors,
            java.lang.String[] labels)
        Colors and labels that will be appended to the end of the auto calculated colors and labels arrays after calculating the legend. (if the legend has already been calculated, you will need to call notifyDataSetChanged() to let the changes take effect)

      • setCustom

        public void setCustom(int[] colors,
             java.lang.String[] labels)
        Sets a custom legend's labels and colors arrays. The colors count should match the labels count. * Each color is for the form drawn at the same index. * A null label will start a group. * A ColorTemplate.COLOR_SKIP color will avoid drawing a form This will disable the feature that automatically calculates the legend labels and colors from the datasets. Call resetCustom() to re-enable automatic calculation (and then notifyDataSetChanged() is needed to auto-calculate the legend again)

      • setCustom

        public void setCustom(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> colors,
             java.util.List<java.lang.String> labels)
        Sets a custom legend's labels and colors arrays. The colors count should match the labels count. * Each color is for the form drawn at the same index. * A null label will start a group. * A ColorTemplate.COLOR_SKIP color will avoid drawing a form This will disable the feature that automatically calculates the legend labels and colors from the datasets. Call resetCustom() to re-enable automatic calculation (and then notifyDataSetChanged() is needed to auto-calculate the legend again)

      • resetCustom

        public void resetCustom()
        Calling this will disable the custom legend labels (set by setCustom(...)). Instead, the labels will again be calculated automatically (after notifyDataSetChanged() is called).

      • isLegendCustom

        public boolean isLegendCustom()
        Returns:
        true if a custom legend labels and colors has been set default false (automatic legend)

      • setWordWrapEnabled

        public void setWordWrapEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Should the legend word wrap? / this is currently supported only for: BelowChartLeft, BelowChartRight, BelowChartCenter. / note that word wrapping a legend takes a toll on performance. / you may want to set maxSizePercent when word wrapping, to set the point where the text wraps. / default: false
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • isWordWrapEnabled

        public boolean isWordWrapEnabled()
        If this is set, then word wrapping the legend is enabled. This means the legend will not be cut off if too long.
        Returns:

      • getMaxSizePercent

        public float getMaxSizePercent()
        The maximum relative size out of the whole chart view. / If the legend is to the right/left of the chart, then this affects the width of the legend. / If the legend is to the top/bottom of the chart, then this affects the height of the legend. / If the legend is the center of the piechart, then this defines the size of the rectangular bounds out of the size of the "hole". / default: 0.95f (95%)
        Returns:

      • setMaxSizePercent

        public void setMaxSizePercent(float maxSize)
        The maximum relative size out of the whole chart view. / If the legend is to the right/left of the chart, then this affects the width of the legend. / If the legend is to the top/bottom of the chart, then this affects the height of the legend. / If the legend is the center of the PieChart, then this defines the size of the rectangular bounds out of the size of the "hole". / default: 0.95f (95%)
        Parameters:
        maxSize -

      • calculateDimensions

        public void calculateDimensions(android.graphics.Paint labelpaint,
                       ViewPortHandler viewPortHandler)
        Calculates the dimensions of the Legend. This includes the maximum width and height of a single entry, as well as the total width and height of the Legend.
        Parameters:
        labelpaint -
